intro: Vilfa sciurea, commonly known as the silky vilfa, is a perennial herb native to the temperate regions of Europe. It features slender, upright stems that are often covered in fine, silky hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in the summer months. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a soft, hairy texture, contributing to its ornamental value. Vilfa sciurea prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a suitable choice for garden cultivation.
